attributes.action: Remove ‘precious cancelled insurance penalty’ for victims of redundancy
attributes.additional_details: I believe that is unfair for large corporate companies to financially gain from peoples misfortune. I have as a job coach, employment advisor and recruiter met lots of people that have been affected. It appears that it stays with you for ever as the question just states “have you ever had an insurance policy cancelled?” I would like the government to amend this so that anyone that can prove they have been affected by redundancy will not be penalised moving forward
attributes.background: Currently if you have had a insurance policy cancelled due to missed payments. You have to take a box on the form when applying for new insurance. Your insurance is increased and you are penalised for this come out there is no date so time is it taking into consideration like accidents are.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the decisions by insurers on the cost of premiums or the criteria they use.
